Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that President Trump is asking everyone to forward the email, implying his direct endorsement of the Congressional Reform Act of 2017.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or sources to back up the assertion that President Trump is asking supporters to forward the message.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the message represents a Trump-endorsed piece of legislation when in fact it is unrelated to President Trump, Congress, or 2017.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the origin and purpose of the message, such as it being a piece of internet flotsam that has been circulating since 2009.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the message has nothing to do with President Trump, Congress, or 2017.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by presenting the message as a legitimate call for Congressional reform when it is actually unrelated to any official legislative process.
